text.0: i glorify that ram who finds the light of heaven whose hundred noblynatured ones go forth with him.
text.1: with hymns may i turn hither indra to mine aidthe car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call.
text.2: like as a mountain on firm basis unremoved he thousandfold protector waxed in mighty strength.
text.3: when indra joying in the draughts of soma juice forced the clouds slaying vṛtra stayer of their flow.
text.4: for he stays een the stayers spread oer laden cloud rooted in light strengthened in rapture by the wise.
text.5: indra with thought with skilled activity i call most liberal giver for he sates him with the juice.
text.6: whom those that flow in heaven on sacred grass his own assistants noblynatured fill full like the sea.
text.7: beside that indra when he smote down vṛtra stood his helpers straight in form mighty invincible.
text.8: to him as in wild joy he fought with him who stayed the rain his helpers sped like swift streams down a slope.
text.9: when indra thunderarmed made bold by soma draughts as tṛta cleaveth valas fences cleft him through.
text.10: splendour encompassed thee forth shone thy warrior might the rainobstructer lay in midairs lowest deep.
text.11: what time o indra thou didst cast thy thunder down upon the jaws of vṛitra hard to be restrained.
text.12: the hymns which magnify thee indra reach to thee even as waterbrooks flow down and fill the lake.
text.13: tvaṣṭar gave yet more force to thine appropriate strength and forged thy thunderbolt of overpowering might.
text.14: when indra thou whose power is linked with thy bay steeds hadst smitten vṛtra causing floods to flow for man.
text.15: thou heldst in thine arms the metal thunderbolt and settest in the heaven the sun for all to see.
text.16: in fear they raised the lofty selfresplendent hymn praise giving and effectual leading up to heaven.
text.17: when indras helpers fighting for the good of men the maruts faithful to mankind joyed in the light.
text.18: then heaven himself the mighty at that dragons roar reeled back in terror when indra thy thunderbolt.
text.19: in the wild joy of soma had struck off with might the head of vṛtra tyrant of the earth and heaven.
text.20: o indra were this earth extended forth tenfold and men who dwell therein multiplied day by day.
text.21: still here thy conquering might maghavan would be famed it hath waxed vast as heaven in majesty and power.
text.22: thou bold of heart in thine own native might for help upon the limit of this midair and of heaven.
text.23: hast made the earth to be the pattern of thy strength embracing flood and light thou reachest to the sky.
text.24: thou art the counterpart of earth the master of lofty heaven with all its mighty heroes.
text.25: thou hast filled all the region with thy greatness yea of a truth there is none other like thee.
text.26: whose amplitude the heaven and earth have not attained whose bounds the waters of midair have never reached.
text.27: not when in joy he fights the stayer of the rain thou and none else hast made all things in order due.
text.28: the maruts sang thy praise in this encounter and in thee all the deities delighted.
text.29: what time thou indra with thy spiky weapon thy deadly bolt smotest the face of vṛtra.
